http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name.@value: W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group
W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group
W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value: This ontology is based on the SSN Ontology by the W3C Semantic Sensor Networks Incubator Group (SSN-XG), together with considerations from the W3C/OGC Spatial Data on the Web Working Group.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/title.@value: Sensor, Observation, Sample, and Actuator (SOSA) Ontology

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.@value:
Measures the temperature and humidity of the surrounding air.
Works on 3.3 - 5.5 volts

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: When measuring the height of a tree, the height is the observed ObservableProperty, 20m may be the Result of the Observation, and the tree is the FeatureOfInterest. A window is a FeatureOfInterest for an automatic window control Actuator.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The height of a tree, the depth of a water body, or the temperature of a surface are examples of observable properties, while the value of a classic car is not (directly) observable but asserted.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The activity of estimating the intensity of an Earthquake using the Mercalli intensity scale is an Observation as is measuring the moment magnitude, i.e., the energy released by said earthquake.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities, particularly Sensors, Actuators, Samplers, and other Platforms.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities, particularly Sensors, Actuators, Samplers, and other Platforms.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: A post, buoy, vehicle, ship, aircraft, satellite, cell-phone, human or animal may act as platforms for (technical or biological) sensors or actuators.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The Result of an Observation, Actuation, or act of Sampling. To store an observation's simple result value one can use the hasSimpleResult property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The Result of an Observation, Actuation, or act of Sampling. To store an observation's simple result value one can use the hasSimpleResult property.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: The value 20 as the height of a certain tree together with the unit, e.g., Meter.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: Accelerometers, gyroscopes, barometers, magnetometers, and so forth are Sensors that are typically mounted on a modern smart phone (which acts as Platform). Other examples of sensors include the human eyes.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between an Actuation and the property of a FeatureOfInterest it is acting upon.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between an Actuation and the property of a FeatureOfInterest it is acting upon.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: In the activity (Actuation) of automatically closing a window if the temperature in a room drops below 20 degrees Celsius, the property on which the Actuator acts upon is the state of the window as it changes from being open to being closed.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: For example, in an Observation of the weight of a person, the FeatureOfInterest is the person and the property is its weight.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a FeatureOfInterest and the Sample used to represent it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a FeatureOfInterest and the Sample used to represent it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The simple value of an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The simple value of an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: For instance, the values 23 or true.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between an ActuatableProperty of a FeatureOfInterest and an Actuation changing its state.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between an ActuatableProperty of a FeatureOfInterest and an Actuation changing its state.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#exam.@value: In the activity (Actuation) of automatically closing a window if the temperature in a room drops below 20 degrees Celsius, the property on which the Actuator acts upon is the state of the window as it changes from being open to being closed.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A relation between a FeatureOfInterest and an Observation about it, an Actuation acting on it, or an act of Sampling that sampled it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A relation between a FeatureOfInterest and an Observation about it, an Actuation acting on it, or an act of Sampling that sampled it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, and the Platform that it is mounted on or hosted by.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, and the Platform that it is mounted on or hosted by.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between an ObservableProperty and the Sensor able to observe it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between an ObservableProperty and the Sensor able to observe it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation linking a Result to the Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling that created or caused it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation linking a Result to the Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling that created or caused it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation from a Sample to the FeatureOfInterest that it is intended to be representative of.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation from a Sample to the FeatureOfInterest that it is intended to be representative of.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between an Actuator and the Actuation it has made.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between an Actuator and the Actuation it has made.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation linking an Actuation to the Actuator that made that Actuation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation linking an Actuation to the Actuator that made that Actuation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation linking an act of Sampling to the Sampler (sampling device or entity) that made it.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation linking an act of Sampling to the Sampler (sampling device or entity) that made it.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a Sensor and an Observation made by the Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a Sensor and an Observation made by the Sensor.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a Sampler (sampling device or entity) and the Sampling act it performed.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a Sampler (sampling device or entity) and the Sampling act it performed.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Relation between a Sensor and an ObservableProperty that it is capable of sensing.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Relation between a Sensor and an ObservableProperty that it is capable of sensing.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The time that the Result of an Observation, Actuation or Sampling applies to the FeatureOfInterest. Not necessarily the same as the resultTime. May be an Interval or an Instant, or some other compound TemporalEntity.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The time that the Result of an Observation, Actuation or Sampling applies to the FeatureOfInterest. Not necessarily the same as the resultTime. May be an Interval or an Instant, or some other compound TemporalEntity.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The result time is the instant of time when the Observation, Actuation or Sampling activity was completed.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The result time is the instant of time when the Observation, Actuation or Sampling activity was completed.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.
